title: Implement unboxing optimisation
body:
Implement unboxing: when a value is always a single-constructor type with one field, eliminate the constructor wrapper.

**Deliverables:**
- Identify variables/returns that HPT shows are always a single constructor with one field (e.g. `CInt n`)
- Replace the boxed representation with the raw unboxed value
- Update all `store`/`fetch`/`case` operations accordingly
- Handle function parameters and return values that can be unboxed
- Unit tests showing unboxing applied to `Int`, `Char`, and `newtype` wrappers

**Design notes:**
- This is a major performance optimisation — avoids heap allocation for simple values
- GHC does this via worker-wrapper; GRIN does it as a GRIN-to-GRIN transformation
- Must be careful with polymorphic code where the type isn't known to be single-constructor
